description: Parking next to the pool ideal for hot hours and overnight and with recreational area next to the children and eat

title: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - Camino Molino
title_short: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - Camino Molino

title: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - 11 Calle Río Duero
title_short: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - 11 Calle Río Duero

title: (47115) Bercero - VP-5602

title: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - 5A Calle del Río
title_short: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - 5A Calle del Río

title_short: (47114) Torrecilla de la Abadesa - Unnamed Road
description: Only corner sheltered after Tordesillas

title: (47239) Villanueva de Duero -
description: Very peaceful little place by the Duero river. Only one place for small van Cc. Small dusty path so be kind enough to drive slowly to avoid smoking out any walkers. The place is located 2km from the village of San Miguel del Pinto with all amenities, small restaurant, grocery store...

title: (47239) Villanueva de Duero -
description: Bivouac place in the pine forest along the Douro.. very quiet. be careful not to make a fire because it is very dry. we had a quiet night. possibility to park several vehicles. more suitable for 4x4s and vans.

title: (47490) Rueda - 23 Calle Las Eras
description: Motorhome area with water filling and emptying service. There are places for about 7 motorhomes, two of them with shade.

title: (47490) Rueda - 50 Calle Real
description: Parallel to the main street next to the cemetery, very quiet at night, you only hear the highway rushing in the distance. Opposite a very good Vinoteca Maxi. In the area also many Bodegas.

title: (47132) Tordesillas - VA-VP-5804
description: It is a truck parking lot but now they are expanding and servicing motorhomes. By eating in the restaurant there are hours of free parking. You can spend the night there. There is a guard 24 hours. You can also store the caravan there, you can choose whether to keep it outdoors or in a ship. The price is 35 or 60 euros per month depending on where you keep it.

title: (47132) Villamarciel - 8B Calle Prado
description: Small picnic area next to a playground. It has trees and room for 3/4 motorhomes. Fountain with drinking water. Next to the Senda del Duero (GR) Located 1.2 kms from the A62. Quiet town.

title: (47490) Rueda - 108 Calle Santísimo Cristo
description: Playground at the end of the main street of the city. picnic area and fountain. Very quiet to spend the night. city ​​with interesting gastronomic offer.

title: (47239) Villanueva de Duero - 49 Polígono San Martín
title_short: (47239) Villanueva de Duero - 49 Polígono San Martín
description: New municipal installation. There are picnic tables behind the hermitage.

title: (47491) La Seca - 36 Calle Santísimo Cristo
description: Parking 2 minutes from the main square of the town. In the village, bakeries, butchers, bars and restaurant. The parking lot is located between the funeral home and the cemetery. Quiet place to spend the night. It has no services.

title: (47491) La Seca - 4 Calle Santiago Sanz
description: Municipal parking lot with a source of drinking water, garbage containers and a bar in front with food-type portions and hamburgers. It is also the starting point of wine tourism routes

title: (47491) La Seca - 1 Plaza Olma
description: Parking for several Motorhomes with water point and sewage discharge. You can visit several Verdejo wine cellars.

title: (47130) Panorama - Unnamed Road
description:
Small bay overlooking a tributary of the Douro. Maximum 2 small vans or one larger vehicle. The GPS does not yet know the gravel road.
Peaceful place if you don't want to pause at a rest stop.

title: (47116) Pollos -
description: Big parking lot for campervans next to the gas station, just off the highway.

title: (47192) Castrodeza - 42 Calle del Pozo
description: Newly created area. 6 seats. Level and shaded (afternoon). Very calm. All services, except electricity. Next to a children's play area, sports court, paddle tennis and soccer field. Many nearby towns to see. The views from the Peñaflor de Hornija viewpoint are essential. Torrelobaton Castle, Santa Espina Monastery and very close to Valladolid. Exclusive use of motorhomes.

title: (47134) Torrelobatón - 23 Calle Hospital
description: Earthen parking around the castle of Torrelobaton. It is said that the castle is the best preserved of Castile and Leon, a visit is mandatory. The town is 50 meters away and includes, among other things, an impressive church (the interior is amazing), a plaza and pleasing municipal pools.

title: (47130) Simancas - 5136 Calle de Robladillo
description: Quiet place to swim and spend the night.

title: (47130) Simancas - 11 Camino Ronda
description: Parking near the center, easy access from the highway, free for lunch or overnight, highway close enough, earplugs recommended. No service.

title: (47130) Simancas - 16D Carretera Puente Duero
description: Parking next to the football fields, quite shady, with plenty of parking spaces.

title: (47130) El Plantío - 29 Carretera Puente Duero
description: Simancas is a Spanish municipality in the province of Valladolid, in the autonomous community of Castilla y León. In the town, located next to the course of the Pisuerga River, there is the General Archive of Simancas. Area requested by the Castilian and Leonese Motorhome Association. Thank you to the city council for its creation.

title: (47130) Simancas - Camino del Batán
description: Bucolic break at the edge of the water with optional visit of the village. While crossing the river by the stone bridge, you will be able to accede to a bar where to drink a glass on the grass in the shade of tall trees.

title: (47112) Los Villaesteres - VA-VP-6701
description: Motorhome services area at Repsol gas station including an open roofed wash station for the campervan and lorries

title: (47112) Pedrosa del Rey - 13 Calle Platerias

There are several routes to do both on foot and by mountain bike (Wikiloc) a few meters from the parkin, being able to walk and thus take advantage and see the town, it has a shop and bar (plaza del ayntamiento) next to the San Miguel S.XVI church. The town has its charm.

title: (47220) Pozaldez - 5 Plaza Corretoro
description: A town famous for Luisito de Pozaldez, famous in many towns in Castilla for making a living reciting minstrels in exchange for money, it has a monument in honor of him, it also has two bars and two Gothic-style churches

title: (47152) Puente Duero-Esparragal - 1 Camino Playa
description: Return of Morocco lay at the water's edge access heavyweight nickel. Quiet to spend the night or even a few days

title: (47230) Matapozuelos -
description: Near the Vado de la Cobatilla path. Also near the river, paddling. Very quiet, in the middle of nature, on the edge of a fragrant pine forest and overlooking flower meadows. We only had a picnic here, but it seems wonderful to spend the night.

title: (47016) Valladolid - 50 P.Act.las Raposas 1

description: Parking to start via verde train of the donkey, about 7kms round trip accessible wheelchair, bicycles.

title: (47140) Laguna de Duero - 16 Calle Tajo
description: Ample parking, shared with all types of vehicles. No service. Stable sand floor Bars, restaurant, supermarket, gas station, etc. very close. Perfect to visit the town.

title: (47140) Laguna de Duero - 39T Calle Nogal
description: Quiet place to spend the night. There is a supermarket, a DIY store and a shop for items for caravans and camping.

title: (47400) Medina del Campo - Unnamed Road

title: (47520) Castronuño - CL-602
description:
3.4km circuit start/end point.

no services

title: (47510) Valladolid -
description: 500m as the crow flies from the road and close to the church on the hill there is a very large picnic area on several levels where you can park among the pine trees. We were only there at noon, but at night and as far as possible on this promontory with a wonderful view. Very quiet place. There is a light socket under the column of the picnic area, on the side of the well is the pillar that faces the other side of the parking lot from the outside

title: (47014) Valladolid - 5 Avenida del Real Valladolid
description: The parking lot of a fast food restaurant (Popeyes), quiet, seemed safe for the night. No problem during our sleep.

title: (47510) Alaejos - Unnamed Road
description: Drinking water source all year round

title: (47014) Valladolid - Camino Caño Morante
description: A quiet place in front of the Valladolid stadium with many places

title: (47520) Castronuño - 27 Camino Carreter Bóveda
description:
Municipal motorhome area: free discharge of gray and black water and filling with clean water. paying electricity. Las Riberas de Castronuño is a natural area between the towns of Tordesillas and Castronuño. The importance of this reserve resides, fundamentally, in nesting. In addition, it is an excellent wintering area for numerous waterfowl.
Attention! Instead of going to the town hall as the sign says, you have to go to the nearby El Guacamayo bar.
This area and eco-sanitary point has been promoted by the Castilian and Leonese motorhome association. ACYLA

title: (47400) Medina del Campo - 38 Camino Velascálvaro-Urblassalinas
description: Área recreational Las Salinas, con mesas and sombras in a pinar al lado del Hotel Palacio Las Salinas.

title: (49810) Morales de Toro - 6 Avenida Comuneros
description:
Free Motorhome Area, with drinking water, emptying of Grays and Blacks. 2 tables. Well lighted.
 Bars, restaurant, supermarket, hardware store, kiosk, haberdashery, mechanical workshops, gas station, cellars, liquor factory and wine museum in the same town. Municipal swimming pool in summer, playground for children and bio-health park.

title: (47008) Valladolid - 8 Calle de la Azucarera
description: Parking in the Parque de las Norias, an old factory converted into a beautiful park, relatively close to the center, supermarkets and bars nearby, crossing the tracks by a pedestrian crossing, a dog park, a quiet place to walk and spend the night. there is also a water fountain but a bit far from the place to park

title: (47510) Alaejos - 182 N-620
description: Behind the gas station. Large esplanade to sleep at night. Good place to rest away from the noise of the Salamanca-Valladolid highway. Very quiet area Possibility of water and shower if the gas station is open.

title: (47641) La Santa Espina - 2 Paseo Generalisimo
description: Recently activated area in a very quiet village, along the Alameda del Río Bajoz. Flat, picnic tables, sand play area with goal posts and trash. In front of the basketball sports area, playground and bar. Above the Rincon Labrador restaurant, comfortable and full of quality. Perfect to visit the monastery of La Santa Espina, with an impressive exhibition of butterflies. Several trails (one to the reservoir).

title: (47014) Valladolid - 6P Calle Pío del Río Hortega
title_short: (47014) Valladolid - 6P Calle Pío del Río Hortega
description: Very quiet night, 2 km from the city center on foot?

title: (47014) Valladolid - 10A Calle Antonio Lorenzo Hurtado
description:
Parking next to the Río Pisuerga promenade. Very calm.
tourist squares but with wide sidewalks that allow us to park our 5-7m vehicles.

title: (47014) Valladolid - 4 Calle Gavilla
description: SmartWash laundry opening hours from 8:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day of the year

title: (47510) Alaejos - 12 Calle Huerta Grande
description: Small water fountain next to a kindergarten.

title: (47014) Valladolid - 2 Calle Calixto Valverde
description: Street with free parking spaces 10min from the center of Valladolid with public toilets on the other side of the bridge.

name: Motorhome Parking Valladolid
title: (47009) Motorhome Parking Valladolid
description: Motorhome area paying 5 euros for 24 hours. Quiet area 10 minutes from downtown. Bars for breakfast next door. If you go with pets, there is a vet next door for any emergency. Green areas for pets. Emptying of gray and black water (box on the ground) and filling with water in another box on the ground with water intakes. You pay when you arrive by parking meter or app. recommendable

title: (47009) Valladolid - 39P Calle Balago
description: Large parking area, near the police and the Service Area, dimly lit at night. Be careful on days when there is a lot of activity at the nearby Trade Fair and on weekday mornings it can be difficult to maneuver in the car park. Supermarket DAY next door.

title: (47870) Tiedra - 7 Calle Santa Maria
description: Parking behind Castillo de Tiedra. Children's swings. Magnificent views of the castle, especially at night with its lighting. No services. Nearby fountain, at the access to the Castle.

title: (47014) Valladolid - 6 Calle Leopoldo de Castro
description: Free parking area, very close to the tourist center.

title: (47510) Alaejos - 14 Avenida Arrabal
description: drinking fountain

title: (47009) Valladolid - 7 Calle Trilla
description: Very ample parking. A little lean. In front of supermarket. 20 minutes to the center.

title: (47870) Tiedra -
description: Newly opened motorhome area. To date, it is not signposted and we have found out because they have told us about it at the Labanda Interpretation Center that is right next door. It has newly planted trees and an area that can probably park more than 50 motorhomes. It has a place to collect water and empty both gray and black water.

title: (47861) Villardefrades - 212 A-6
description: Parking of the Gas Station, it is open 24 hours including the bar... Exit 211 of the A-6 It has a small area inside the bar for the little ones to play.

title: (47870) Tiedra - Camino Ermita
description: Hermitage of Tiedra the old one, wooden benches, small shadows, fresh water. Spectacular scenery. And the hermitage is visitable ... There is a cemetery and no one around. Between two small towns. For those who like these places, it has something magical.

title: (47004) Valladolid - 4 Calle San Luis
description: Laundromat, open from 8:00 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. Every day.

title: (47510) Alaejos - 55 Calle Antonio Machado
description: New parking area for 7 motorhomes and vans with running water and drainage services, in a very quiet area with views of the pretty town of Alaejos, where there are all kinds of services. Tables to eat and sports facilities in case you want to play a game of paddle tennis. Electricity costs and the key can be picked up at the Parchís bar.

title: (47012) Valladolid - 73A Calle Canterac
description: Perfect place in the center and very quiet.

title: (47510) Alaejos - 184 N-620
description: Parking in restaurant, very quiet and guarded, toilets in the restaurant

title: (47193) Cistérniga - 1 Camino Renedo
description: Flat unpaved place with easy access for both Camper and Ac good place for day and night very quiet, residential area bar, lupa supermarket churreria less than 50 meters super quiet night

title: (47862) Urueña - VP-5606
description: Rest area and a Romanesque chapel, trees, shade and carved stone tables.

title: (47161) Herrera de Duero - 25 Camino del Puente
title_short: (47161) Herrera de Duero - 25 Camino del Puente
description: In Herrera de Duero, next to the Valladolid-Segovia highway. 10 minutes from Valladolid, very quiet at night. Next to a small beach on the Douro river for bathing in Summer. In the village there are small supermarkets, bars and restaurants.

title: (47510) Alaejos - Arroyo de la Reguera
description:
Fuente del Caño

you can fill up potable water at a small tap. only filling up bottles, no hose for motorhomes.

acces over a dusty path, some potholes but not too difficult. bigger MH might have problems as the path becomes narrow in the end. 

theres a sign shortly before Alaejos (coming from south on the N-620) to the right that says "Fonte del Cañao". follow the path, turn right at the next crossing, then slightly left (blue arrows on a pole), go straight for about 1.3km, turn right and follow the narrow path through the trees until you see a picnic area to your right, the tap is right behind:)

title: (49870) Villavendimio - 3 Calle San Andres
description: Quiet parking on the outskirts of a small village, and small public fountain to refuel.

title: (47010) Valladolid - 9 Plaza Ribera de Castilla
description: New laundry, we park 150m away with our 7.50m CC (calle de la Rábida).

title: (47161) Herrera de Duero - 11 Plaza Mayor
description: Ample parking to visit the town with playground.

title: (47011) Valladolid - 6D Camino del Cementerio
description: Quiet street with parking on both sides of the road. The center is about 15 minutes walk. We have dined at the gondomatik restaurant (good food and live music) and we have spent one night here. Overall a pleasant stay.

title: (47162) Aldeamayor de San Martín - s/n Paseo del Arroyo
title_short: (47162) Aldeamayor de San Martín - s/n Paseo del Arroyo
description: area the grove

title: (47862) Urueña - 1 Calle de la Costanilla
description: Parking with rest area, picnic tables, water fountain, next to the medieval wall. The city is the first Villa of Spain. Everything is dedicated to the book: Fundación Delibes, museums, etc. Great place to visit the walled city 6 km from the motorway Madrid A Coruña.

title: (47011) Valladolid - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet dirt parking near the center of Valladolid (15 minutes), in front of the university. There is a drinking fountain on the opposite side of the road. It is a large parking lot and accessible to any long vehicle.

title: (47011) Valladolid - 20 Calle Jardines de Sabatini
description: Free unattended parking, 15 minutes walk from the center, is not specific to motorhomes but there is always some, near there is supermarket, shopping center and a bar,

title: (47009) Valladolid - 7c Avenida del Euro
description: Gas refilling at station

title: (47862) Urueña -
description: Quiet parking to spend the day and night. No services

title: (47512) Castrejón de Trabancos - 5 Calle Parajes
description:
motorhome area with six seats and filling and emptying services.
It has a very quiet promenade in which there are two parks for children.

title: (49836) Toro - A-11
description: Nothing fancy, just valid for a night stop. Parking under the trees. At the exit of the highway between Spain and Portugal. Gas station and interchange not far, and 5 minutes from the city. Quiet.

title: (49836) Toro - ZA-705
description: Rest area on the A11 from Tordesillas to Zamora, near Toros. At the roundabout turn right then directly left (it is well indicated). Arriving on the right a large wasteland rolling with gravel on the ground. There were 3 motorhomes when we arrived, we put ourselves on the same ground. Apparently the police go round and see if all goes well on this ground (we met during their round, no problem). In front of this land, gas station, bar, small supermarket and WC. Everything is open all night

title: (49800) Toro - 3D Camino Picaltordo
description: Large parking with firm ground and sand. Quiet for the night.

title: (49800) Toro - 16 Barrio Carmen
description: Motorhome area recently built by the Toro town hall (still not finished on pavement but well enough to be used). Beautiful views of La Vega del Duero; 2 min till Alcázar de Toro (where the tourist office is located) and 5 min till Plaza Mayor. Toro is medieval and historic town known for its wine, the Grape Harvest Festival, the San Agustín Festival and Holy Week in Tores. If your visit coincides with any of these festivities, you will not get bored, promised.

title: () Toro - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful picnic area very close to the Douro River as it passes through Toro, nearby it has a restaurant and a bar on the other side

title: (49800) Toro - 5 Plaza San Agustín
description: In the Plaza de San Agustín, in front of the Alcázar de Toro. 5 minutes from Plaza Mayor, quiet overnight. Perfectly situated.

title: (47320) Tudela de Duero -
description:
Inmitten eines Pinienwaldes.
4x4 ist nicht erforderlich.
Natur pur.

title: (49800) Toro - Unnamed Road
description: Wild and hidden, without access complications. With views of the rock bridge over the Douro River. You can walk to Toro in 10 minutes passing under the train track. Mosquitoes Vineyards and wineries

title: (49800) Toro - 44 Avenida de Carlos Pinilla
description: Parking at the lane side of the Avenue, next to the house of the barracks of the Civil Guard. There is also a field with a greater amplitude. Uncrowded near the center of Toro and the night.

title: (47170) Renedo de Esgueva - Sector Sau 10
description: Free parking in a picnic area, with fountain and basketball courts along the Esgueva River, great place for walking, cycling or enjoying the cuisine of Renedo de Esgueva, just two kilometers along. the bike path this park "the valley of the six senses" strongly recommended to go with the children. more there is open access in a youth center

title: (47162) Los Aljibes - Unnamed Road
description: Recreation area equipped with barbecues, tables, gazebos, children's games. Space for many vehicles.

title: (47493) San Vicente del Palacio - Autovía del Noroeste
title_short: (47493) San Vicente del Palacio - Autovía del Noroeste
description: I spent the night, so be careful with the generator running all night, for those who are light sleepers a lot of truck traffic, and a lot of refrigerated trucks in front of the hotel and not far from the RV area. and buses with a lot of passengers. it would be good if the people at the station asked the refrigerated trucks to go further because the parking lot is really big. otherwise, restaurant, shop etc ... sorry I did not inquire about the prices of the services because I do not speak Spanish.

title: (47160) Portillo - 44 Calle Colegio
description: IMPORTANT: From September 7 to 10 (both included), PARKING AND OVERNIGHT STAYS PROHIBITED due to the Patron Saint Holidays (sorry for the inconvenience). Nice place to rest. It has a water fountain in the picnic area. A loading and unloading space has been operational for 2 months. This area and eco-sanitary point has been promoted by the Castilian and Leonese association of motorhome owners (ACYLA). Inaugurated on May 30, 2022. Exclusive use for motorhomes and campers.

title: (47160) Portillo - 1D Avenida Castillo
description: Parking the feet of the Castle with incredible views. Phenomenal to visit the beautiful town of Portillo, taste its famous mantecados and know its crafts.

title: (47410) Olmedo - Paseo de san Juan
description: Parking area on Paseo San Juan, it is not a suburb street, it is on Paseo San Juan, a quiet, tree-lined area, with well leveled sand without services but with nearby containers and a water source 100 meters away. Ideal for a night or two if you don't need many services. 5 minutes away there is another area of Caravans somewhat neglected but with water services and wastewater and waste bins.

title: (47410) Olmedo - 1 Camino Cementerio
description: Very quiet place to sleep, and away from the road. We tried to sleep here, because the AC area is right next to the national road and it was very noisy at night.

title: (47320) Tudela de Duero - 39 Calle Herrera
description: Pinar Herrera Street, Tudela de Duero. Follow the street to the pine forest where you can sleep.

title: () Olmedo - N-601
description: Motorhome area next to the Mudejar museum

title: (47480) Fresno el Viejo - 2 Paseo Piscinas
description: Quiet and level place behind the municipal swimming pools. There are tables and barbecues even though right now it is somewhat neglected, I don't know if because of all this Covid. In the town there is everything, you can walk from here and there you can visit a small zoo with a playground and magnificent attention, a nature classroom, a winery with plasticine figures and an ethnographic museum. Very complete to spend the weekend.

title: (49840) Vezdemarbán - 29 Lugar Diseminados
description: Parking of the municipal swimming pool, level concrete floor, drinking water and tables. In summer possibility of access to the swimming pool with showers and toilets. Small charming town, you can visit quickly. Recommended.

title: (47320) Tudela de Duero - 60A Calle Herrera
description: Double service station with small adjacent parking but wider 100 m away (following asphalted way) max overnight = 72 h, illuminated and shadow, aside sport area, along Douro river in Tudela de Duero village which center is opposite riverside; cycling and walkway crosses the river and leads to the center of small town, with return by main bridge (30 min circuit).

title: (47320) Tudela de Duero - SN Avenida de la Estación
title_short: (47320) Tudela de Duero - SN Avenida de la Estación
description: Perfect location 2 minutes from the city center on foot near an old freight station. flat and gravelled ground there are a few holes

title: () Cogeces de Íscar - VP-1202
description: Beautiful San Marugan Recreation Area Recreational area with incredible views in a unique pine forest in the province of Valladolid. No services, only tables, but the walks are well worth a visit.

title: (47850) Villanueva de los Caballeros - Área de descanso
title_short: (47850) Villanueva de los Caballeros - Área de descanso
description: Rest area with picnic areas. Shadowless area. Lots of parking spaces.

title: (47270) Cigales - 5 Ronda Especería
description: Winnie's laundry. Great launderette at super cheap prices and a parking space right outside the door. You can eat while waiting for your laundry at the Kebab next door or do your shopping at the supermarket 100m away.

title: (49155) La Bóveda de Toro - 19A Calle Guareña
title_short: (49155) La Bóveda de Toro - 19A Calle Guareña
description: Good place, water, calm, filling and emptying

title: (47270) Cigales - 30 Calle Majada
description: New AC 2021 area in a large town, 5km from the highway, in a quiet area. It has 3 free places. Drinking water (be careful, in winter the tap may be frozen), gray and black water drained. It is better to enter large motorhomes through Los cortijos avenue (the road where the Lupa supermarket is). Near paths to walk, bakery (delicious), visit wineries and swimming pool in summer.

title: (47410) Aguasal - Camino de la Ermita
description: Recreational area next to the hermitage of Sacedon. Pine forest area with picnic tables. Very quiet to spend the night. There is no source or services

title: (47260) Cabezón de Pisuerga - Autovía de Castilla
title_short: (47260) Cabezón de Pisuerga - Autovía de Castilla
description: Large car park, with tables and bins. Highway at 150m, without much noise.

title: (47160) Portillo - VA-V-2052
description: Fuente Minguez recreational area. Natural environment surrounded by pine trees. Access by asphalted forest path from Portillo or La Parrilla and from Montemayor by dirt forest road. Barbecue service, fountain (not all year), indoor soccer and basketball court, as well as a children's playground.

title: (47260) Cabezón de Pisuerga - 30 Calle Pablo Picasso
title_short: (47260) Cabezón de Pisuerga - 30 Calle Pablo Picasso
description: Public Park in residential area with kids playground. No services. Very quiet. We spent one night without problems.

title: (47210) Ataquines - Camino del Silo
description: Public parking next to municipal swimming pool and bar, quiet (maybe not so much on weekends), without traffic, flat, shade, between cereal fields. Possibility of sleeping.

title: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Unnamed Road
title_short: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Unnamed Road
description: Wonderfully shady place under pine trees, ideal for a break or siesta

title: (47260) Cabezón de Pisuerga - 2 Ronda Independencia
description: Great quiet place on a river with old bridge! Just awesome

title: (47260) Cabezón de Pisuerga - 18 Calle Rosa Chacel
title_short: (47260) Cabezón de Pisuerga - 18 Calle Rosa Chacel
description: Playground and tree shade

title: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña
title_short: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña
description: Castrillo de la Guareña has a motorhome area belonging to the Ruta Raia Norte (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe). The area has picnic areas and a playground. It has 10 parking spaces and an eco-sanitary services platform for these vehicles, Wi-Fi connection and 24-hour surveillance. Avoid the area from August 8 to 12, due to patron saint festivities and possible noise.

address.street: Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña

title: (47281) Corcos - Unnamed Road
description: Monastery car park. Quiet place. After visiting Valladolid, it was a rest stop. There is no service but it is a quiet place. You can hear the background noise of the highway and a train track passes nearby but it is still a very quiet place.

title: (47420) Íscar - 11 Calle Ronda
description: Self-service laundry open from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., every day of the year. We also have a 24-hour vending service with drinks, snacks and parapharmacy. We are in front of the Gadis supermarket, an easy parking area. In the urban center, we recommend going up to the castle of Íscar.

title: (47219) San Pablo de la Moraleja - 8 Calle de la Iglesia
title_short: (47219) San Pablo de la Moraleja - 8 Calle de la Iglesia
description: In 40 years as a camper, I have never seen a place as ideal as this, apart from Bergondo, which is in Galicia, well to the north. Under the gigantic tree, you don't have to move according to the time of day to have shade. The tap to load the water is 30 meters away. In midsummer, it is neither hot nor cold. The town, there are four houses. Very very quiet and safe. It is just 5 minutes from the A6 motorway. For those who are heading north, coming from Madrid, it is a very good choice to spend a few days.

title: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 1 Calle Corro de Santiago
title_short: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 1 Calle Corro de Santiago
description: In this small square and the one right next to it, you can park and even spend the night. space for motorhomes is a bit tight but vans are no problem. There are no services, but there is a water pipe from a public fountain nearby. Very quiet, right in the center of town.

title: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 32 Calle San Juan
title_short: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 32 Calle San Juan
description: New laundry next to the Castilla canal and near the new AC area

title: (49410) Fuentelapeña - ZA-602
description: Beautiful location at the end of the village near the football field, with picnic area and barbecue very quiet night.

title: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 3 Calle Dársena
description: Small car park, without service. Quiet area and 5 minutes walk from the old town, near the Dársena del Castilla Canal. Ideal for bike paths.

title: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 3 Calle Raúl Guerra Garrido
title_short: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 3 Calle Raúl Guerra Garrido
description: Parking next to the school, close to the Services Area. One area is a bit uneven. Good place for visits and excursions. Weekends very quiet. Let's be respectful. LET'S NOT CAMP, just PARK.

title: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 7 Calle Raúl Guerra Garrido
title_short: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 7 Calle Raúl Guerra Garrido
description: This eco-sanitary point has been promoted by the Castilla y León motorhome association (ACYLA) Exclusively for motorhomes and campers. There are 5 squares right next door or in the surrounding streets there is space. What to see in Medina de Rioseco. San Francisco Museum Walking through the City of Admirals. Holy Week Museum of Medina de Rioseco. The old walls and the Castle of Medina de Rioseco. The Castilian Channel. The San Antonio Flour Factory. Church of Santa María de Mediavilla and Church of Santiago.

title: (47800) Medina de Rioseco - 7 Calle Muelles
description: In front of the canal, with tables and shade. Peaceful place. No services.

title: (47219) Muriel de Zapardiel - 6 Calle Triana
description: Motorhome area with loading and unloading.

title: (05215) Palacios de Goda - Autovía del Noroeste
title_short: (05215) Palacios de Goda - Autovía del Noroeste
description: A very nice place to take a break in a motorhome and our kidneys. It is eaten well, it is not expensive and the staff is super friendly. I haven't slept, but it must be a very quiet place.

title: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - Km. 26 Carretera Peñaranda
title_short: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - Km. 26 Carretera Peñaranda
description: Gas station with a water tap that comes off a lot of pressure. The owner informed us that it was potable water. He let us fill the water tank to full capacity. Very nice !!

title: (47816) Montealegre de Campos - 1 Calle Nicolas Rodriguez
title_short: (47816) Montealegre de Campos - 1 Calle Nicolas Rodriguez
description: Just against the castle of Monteallegre, this spot is quite fantastic. Park on the grass near the castle for more discretion. No shops nearby but public water fountain in the medieval village adjacent to the castle. Be careful though the wind!

title: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 3 Plaza Santa María
title_short: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 3 Plaza Santa María
description: Good place to spend the night, very quiet, Madrigal de las Altas Torres is a historic town in the province of Ávila, famous for being the town where Queen Isabel I of Castilla (Isabel la Católica) was born and lived her childhood. Madrigal still preserves many monuments that tell us about its rich past: a royal palace, four churches, two convents, the royal hospital, the wall with its four doors and its palatial and ancestral homes. Traveling to Madrigal is traveling to the history of Castilla y León. Get to know the Mudejar style so characteristic of the region and discover that the "Cepa de Madrigal" gave rise to the Verdejo white wines so famous in the area today.

title: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 1 Avenida los Deportes
title_short: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 1 Avenida los Deportes
description: Parking to spend the night and see the hometown of Isabel the Catholic.

title: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 7 Plaza del Cristo
title_short: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 7 Plaza del Cristo
description: Place very wide, it is possible to spend the night and very calm.

title: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 26 Paseo de Fuera
title_short: (05220) Madrigal de las Altas Torres - 26 Paseo de Fuera
description: Newly opened motorhome area, with about 50 seats. Near the town with all services and several monuments. Madrigal de las Altas Torres is a town and a municipality in Spain belonging to the province of Ávila, in the autonomous community of Castilla y León. It is one of the most significant towns in the region of La Moraña, located in the north of the province. Isabel de Castilla was born in the town on April 22, 1451. This area and eco-sanitary point has been promoted by the Castellana y Leonesa motorhome association. (ACYLA) Exclusively for motorhomes. The water supply is shut off in winter to prevent pipes from freezing. Contact the town hall if you need water.

title: (47282) - Unnamed Road
description: Very close to exit 102 of the N80 towards Burgos. Quiet corner under the poplars. Flat terrain.

title: (49440) Cañizal - 4 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Near the highway. A little further is a gas station. We spent a quiet night here. Simple and functional. You're standing right now. Okay for one night. Enough space.

name: Área de Autocaravanas “ San Martin “
title: (34191) Área de Autocaravanas “ San Martin “
description: Motorhome Area "San Martin". Very quiet place in the heart of a typical old medieval village. Very nice historical monuments to visit. Air at the end of town with free services. Maximum stay 72h

title: (34191) Ampudia - 26 Calle Reoyo
description: Ample and quiet space, park a truck and is near the town

title: (34305) Villerías de Campos - 1 Calle Travesia Santa Maria
title_short: (34305) Villerías de Campos - 1 Calle Travesia Santa Maria
description: Small picnic area where to spend the night by the side of the road. With drinking water point, shaded plus a picnic table. Possible for two vans. Watch out for stumps. fairly flat terrain.

title: (34305) Villerías de Campos - 16 Calle Granada
description: Comfortable parking place to rest or stay overnight, but above all to get close to a cheese shop near an excellent sheep's cheese typical of Tierra de Campos

title: (05298) Mamblas - 5 Carretera Rasueros Bercial
description: Quiet parking in the town of Mamblas, typical Castilian town, nice people, Alberto bakery, artisan products with quality pastries, bar and pool in summer (€2), free Padel court next door.

title: (05298) Rasueros - 7 Camino Torralba
description: It is a street in this town, the town is very welcoming. It is flat and less than 2 minutes from the municipal swimming pools. No noise is heard. Showers in the pools. No services just for parking
